Kyber.EN: Lattice-based. Based on the learning with errors problem in structured (module) lattices

McEliece.EN: Code-based. Based on the decoding of Goppa codes

Frodo.EN: Lattice-based. Based on the learning with errors problem in unstructured lattices

HQC.EN: Code-based. Based on quasi-cyclic moderate density parity-check

BIKE.EN: Code-based. Based on the Syndrome Decoding problem

McEliece.EN: Most mature algorithm, in use for over 40 years

Kyber.EN: Won NIST's six-year long competition and was selected as its main standard in 2024

McEliece.EN: Still in competition - has been selected for NIST standardization round 4

Frodo.EN: Selected as an alternate candidate by NIST, but not selected for standardization

HQC.EN: Still in competition - has been selected for NIST standardization round 4

BIKE.EN: Still in competition - has been selected for NIST standardization round 4

Kyber.EN: Integrated in ARM Cortex A, M53, M4(F), M0+; FPGA, ASIC, SLE 78, RISC-V

McEliece.EN: Integrated in ARM Cortex M4, FPGA

Frodo.EN: Integrated in ARM Cortex M4, Xilinx Artix-7, ASIC, RISC-V

BIKE.EN: Integrated in VHDL for Xilinx FPGA

Kyber.EN: Very small keys, relatively small ciphertexts

McEliece.EN: Extremely large public keys, but smallest ciphertexts

Frodo.EN: Very large ciphertexts, relatively large keys

Kyber.EN: Fastest key generation, encryption and decryption

McEliece.EN: Extremely slow key generation, but very fast encryption and decryption

Frodo.EN: Very slow encryption, relatively slow decryption and key generation

HQC.EN: Very fast key generation, also fast encryption and decryption

BIKE.EN: Fairly fast key generation, very fast encryption but slower decryption

Kyber.EN: Public key: 0.8 kB, secret key: 1.6 kB, ciphertext: 0.8 kB

McEliece.EN: Public key: 261 kB, secret key: 6.5 kB, ciphertext: 0.1 kB

Frodo.EN: Public key: 9.6 kB, secret key: 20 kB, ciphertext: 9.8 kB

HQC.EN: Public key: 3.0 kB, secret key: 3.0 kB, ciphertext: 6.0 kB

BIKE.EN: Public key: 1.5 kB, secret key: 5.2 kB, ciphertext: 1.6 kB
Has possible decryption failures, related to performance
